frameDefinitions: In this frame an Experiencer experiences an Emotion or is in an Emotional_state.
A Potential_hindrance or an Agent (via their actions) keeps an Event from taking place, or despite the possibility of prevent the Event, do not do so.
A Believer has faith in a piece of Content or an Element  which fits into a religious belief system made up of many articles of faith.
A Cognizer has a piece of Content in their model of the world.
This frame concerns a Cognizer's certainty about the correctness of beliefs  or expectations.
A Cognizer holds a particular Opinion, which may be portrayed as being about a particular Topic.
frameExamples: Rain <t>prevented</t> the ball game from taking place.
Do Muslims <t>believe</t> in the virgin birth of Jesus?
Your boss is <t>aware</t> of your commitment.
Lermontov was <t>certain</t> he would come to the party.
John <t>thinks</t> that it looks better back .
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the <fen>Emotion</fen> or is in the <fen>Emotional_state</fen>.
The <fen>Emotion</fen> is the feeling that the <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences.
The <fen>Emotional_state</fen> is the state the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is in.
The <fen>Evaluation</fen> is a negative or positive assessment of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> regarding his or her <fen>Emotional_state</fen>.
The <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> is the force which keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from happening, or does not.
The <fen>Event</fen> is prevented from occurring by the <fen>Preventing_cause</fen> or the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the sentient being which keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from happening.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> or <fen>Agent</fen> keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from taking place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> or <fen>Agent</fen> keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from taking place.
The <fen>Believer</fen> is the person whose religious beliefs are in question.
The <fen>Content</fen> is the object of the <fen>Believer</fen>'s religious conviction. <fen>Content</fen> can be expressed as a finite clause or in a in-PP Complement.
<fen>Role</fen> is a  function that an Element of the faith is believed to serve.
A predefined, fixed idea to which reference is made throughout the belief system.

The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose awareness of phenomena is at question. With a target verb or adjective the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is generally expressed as an External Argument with the <fen>Content</fen> expressed as an Object or Complement.
The <fen>Content</fen> is the object of the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s awareness. <fen>Content</fen> can be expressed as a direct object or in a PP Complement.
Some verbs in this frame allow a <fen>Topic</fen> to be expressed in about-PPs.
<fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part that reveals the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s state to the observer.
The time interval during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is aware of the <fen>Content</fen>.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose certainty or uncertainty is at issue.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the entity that a <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a certain/uncertain belief about.
The <fen>Content</fen> denotes the mental content that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is certain or uncertain about.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part that conveys the mental state of  the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose <fen>Opinion</fen> is in question.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s way of thinking, which is not necessarily generally accepted, and which is generally dependent on the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s point of view.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has the <fen>Opinion</fen>.
listRoleExamples: After two pints, <fex>he</fex> felt a bit better and Ted arrived.
Patients experience <fex>high anxiety levels</fex> at time of admission to hospital.
Her heart was galloping so fast that she felt <fex>quite giddy with happiness</fex>.
Max was feeling <fex>worse than he'd ever felt in his life</fex>.
A Christian believes <fex>that Jesus of Nazareth was a prophet</fex>.
If a person believes in Jesus <fex>as his Saviour</fex>, he can he baptized.
<fex>Your boss</fex> is aware of your commitment.
Your boss is aware <fex>of your commitment</fex>.

Yet there is no evidence that Mr. Parrish was cognizant <fex>at the time of the signing
of the notes</fex> that the clauses in issue were present.
<fex>Marcel</fex> was sure that she had seen Eldridge on the balcony.
She talked of quests , of finding this absurd religious character , but he was unsure <fex>of her conviction</fex>.
I am sure <fex>that we'll arrive on time</fex>.
She caught sight of her mother's dubious <fex>expression</fex>.
<fex>My</fex> take is that Johnson will not actually make it to the last round .

My take is <fex>that it is a version of the Macbeth story - what happens when people
become violent but cannot quite handle it</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: The University of North Carolina Press
the United Nations Universal Declaration of Human Rights
